column3:
Maybe we could reverse the approach, and allow everything allowed by the [BIP14](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0014.mediawiki). Otherwise we can keep creating 'also allow XX' pulls (yes, I'm guilty of this one) .

I think the conceptual issue is that `SanitizeString` is used for two purposes: 
- to avoid formatting strings that are dangerous to pass to the shell, terminal or d

Assuming ASCII and forgetting about all non printable ASCII chars, leaves us with 33 chars (alphanum is fine) to make a decision about.

`.,;_/:?@()` is already in, so what is left:

```
 !"#$%&'*+-<=>[]\^`{|}~
```

IIrc, UAs get dumped to debug.log as well, so is it save to allow any char?

> IIrc, UAs get dumped to debug.log as well, so is it save to allow any char?

Yes, but only processed through SanitizeString(SAFE_CHARS_DEFAULT) - in principle, just the fact that we don't log some characters doesn't mean that they shouldn't be allowed in uacomments.
Meh, I don't think it's worth it to take this to BIP level - although the BIP should have mentioned valid/invalid characters! Good to check for in next proposal if anything relating strings.\nutACK\n
